YouTube

Welcome to my YouTube Page! Here, I put videos showcasing my projects, Python codes, and their outputs. I also demonstrate some of my work in Cognitive NeuroEngineering, including real-time EEG artifact detection, hand gesture recognition, and more. Each video provides insights into my research and the tools I use to solve complex problems. Explore to see my projects in action!

Real-time EEG Artifact Detection

This video demonstrates real-time detection of various EEG artifact classes, which will later be used as hand movement switches for rehabilitation purposes.

Hand Gesture Recognition

Hand gesture recognition using Python code and the MediaPipe and QtPy libraries.

5 Finger Angle Plot

This code is written in Python using the MediaPipe library and utilizes QtPy. It detects hand fingers, calculates finger angles, and plots them in real time.

Exploring FES Hand Stimulation: Paragrasp Glove Test on a Healthy subject

we investigate the effects of the Paragrasp functional electrical stimulation (FES) glove on a healthy subject. This advanced neurorehabilitation device features 8 reference points and 32 stimulation channels, delivering targeted electrical impulses to specific hand muscles to elicit controlled hand gestures.

Exploring FES Hand Stimulation: Paragrasp Glove Test on a tetraplegic patient

investigate the effects of the Paragrasp functional electrical stimulation (FES) glove on a tetraplegic patient with a cervical spinal cord injury.

EMG Signal Acquisition from a Patient During the Experiment

Patient Walking with ParaWalk

A spinal cord injury patient walking with the aid of a ParaWalk, a neuroprosthetic device designed to help individuals with spinal cord injuries stand and walk. My role is that of a support person, maintaining the wheelchair and providing assistance to the patient.
